identification.role: The Sacred Spear Bearer; witness to resurrection through physical miracle; bridge between Roman occupation and divine intervention; embodiment of redemption and transformation
identification.primary_narrative_function: Bridge between Roman occupation and divine intervention

distinctive_features.eyes: Pre-disease: legendary clarity; post-resurrection: perfect clarity with luminous quality
distinctive_features.scars: Multiple thin scars; prominent scar across left ribs

physical_description.visual_signature: Compact frame with intense assessing eyes; centurion's armor with visible authority; spear positioned as extension of identity

primary_traits.description: Street origins grant danger assessment and endurance
Recognizes humanity especially in the downtrodden
Experiences conflict when duty violates conscience
Deep loyalty with capacity to adjust approaches

strengths.shows_in: Continued performance despite vision decline, maintaining composure under stress
Mercy toward prisoners, recognition of occupied population's desperation
Finding alternative tactics as vision fails, code-switching between formal and informal speech

flaws_and_vulnerabilities.manifestation: Street orphan wearing centurion's armor; persistent doubt about authentic worth
Greatest gift being stolen; loss of gift equals loss of identity
Paralysis when duty conflicts with conscience; difficulty accepting moral compromise
Practical military mind struggles with concepts beyond direct experience
Deep loyalty to Malchus and Rome potentially conflicts with higher spiritual calling

core_motivations: Navigate conflicts between duty and conscience

relationships.dynamic: Deep loyalty; sees as savior from street life; professional respect deepening toward mentorship; witness to both vision deterioration and miraculous restoration
Genuine friendship despite military hierarchy; mutual moral compass; safety of honest conversation rare in military; post-resurrection creates shared knowledge and deepened bond
Initially respects as military peer; then sees as obstacle; finally positions for elimination while maintaining appearance of protection

story_arc.opening_state: Respected centurion hiding vision failure; worships Brutus; isolated
story_arc.transformation: From isolated victim dependent on false mentor, through systematic psychological torture, to spiritual transformation through mercy and grace
story_arc.closing_state: Transformed believer; hunted by Rome; spiritually healed; spear-bearer of manifestation

character.why_readers_care: Longinus represents universal struggle of transformation despite impossible circumstances. His vulnerability and moral integrity create internal tension readers recognize. His spiritual awakening through mercy offers hope.
character_questions_for_readers: What makes someone worthy despite humble origins?
Can you maintain moral integrity within an immoral system?
What happens when the gift that defines us begins to fail?
How do we reconcile duty with conscience when they conflict?
Can spiritual transformation occur in a single moment?
What is the cost of speaking truth when it challenges authority?
Can someone from the lowest origins achieve the highest purpose?
How do we know when we've encountered divine reality?
What does it mean to be chosen for sacred purpose?
